title: Access the Audit UI
content:
You can view the audit records using the Audit UI. You need to have the right permissions to view the audit data on the UI. The VIEW_SYSTEM_LEVEL_AUDIT permission will let you view the system level audits only. The VIEW_TENANT_LEVEL_AUDIT permission will let you view the tenant level audits only. If you have both VIEW_SYSTEM_LEVEL_AUDIT and VIEW_TENANT_LEVEL_AUDIT permissions, you will be able to view system and tenant level audits.

Configure user role for Audit menu visibility in Service Management

As a tenant admin, you can give the audit user the access to view the Audit menu in Service Management by doing either of the following:

Option 1:

  1. Log in to Service Management as a tenant admin and navigate to Administration > People > ROLES.
  2. From the left pane, select an existing SMAX role that the user is part of and view the details. 
  3. Select the Audit module checkbox under the Administration menu visibility field and save the changes.
  4. Also assign the correct audit roles (view-system-level-audit and view-tenant-level-audit) to the user so that the user can view the audit data.

Option 2:

  1. Log in to Service Management as a tenant admin and navigate to Administration > People > ROLES.
  2. In the New role popup window, you can create a new role by setting the Application field as SMAX.
  3. Select this role from the left pane and view the details.
  4. Select the Log into the application checkbox.
  5. Select the Audit module checkbox under the Administration menu visibility field and save the changes.
  6. Assign the edited role to the user.
  7. Also assign the correct audit roles (view-system-level-audit and view-tenant-level-audit) to the user so that the user can view the audit data.

Access the Audit UI

You can access the Audit UI through the following ways:

  • From Suite Administration
  • From Agent Interface
  • Directly through the Audit UI
 
The audit service must be enabled before you can access the Audit UI. To enable audit service, see Enable audit.  

Access the Audit UI from Suite Administration

As a suite administrator, you can access the Audit UI via the Audit button on the main menu of the Suite Administration Portal.

Suite administrators can always access the Audit button and you don't need to configure menu visibility for these users. But to view system and tenant audit data, suite administrators (except for the default suite-admin user) must be assigned to one or more audit user groups in IdM.

Access Audit UI through Agent Interface

If you are logged into the Service Management Agent Interface, you can navigate to the Audit UI from Agent Interface > Administration > Utilities > Audit.

Logging into Audit UI

 
When a custom domain is set for a tenant, users who access the original FQDN and navigate to the Audit page cannot use the Main menu to access other services.

You can access the Audit UI through this login URL:

https://<audit service host>:<audit service port>/audit-gateway?TENANTID=<tenant id> 

On the login page, enter the username and password to access the Audit UI.
